item.title: Report E-2024100279
item.description:
Report E-2024100279

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-11T09:22:09+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-25
  • City: ELLENWOOD
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On September 25, 2024, one (1) 1-gallon pail of UN3149 was damaged in a load shift and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted site. The crew containerized the damaged pail in one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal. FCE personnel utilized neutralizers, absorbents, and hand tools to remediate the site. Allimpacted materials were containerized in the same one (1) 55-gallon drum.

item.title: Report E-2024100244
item.description:
Report E-2024100244

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-10T09:22:34+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-13
  • City: ATLANTA
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 1440ET, XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release located at terminal NAT. It was reported that approximately 1 gallon of Biocide 4 released from (1) 55-gallon poly drum due to a forklift puncture during dock operations (terminal NAT responsible). The release impacted the concrete dock. The caller advised it had already been completely cleaned and containerized into an 85-gallon DM with spent oil dri. The contractors containerized drum to (1) 95-gallon metal drum along with absorbent pads. The waste was staged on site for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report X-2024100449
item.description:
Report X-2024100449

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-09T09:22:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-05
  • City: CONLEY
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ABF FREIGHT SYSTEM, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Kirk Smith, 086 Operations Supervisor, contacted Safety regarding a toxic liquids spill on the dock floor. Kirk Smith advised the freight being punctured by forklift operator, Julius Perrin. Kirk Smith was unable to estimate an amount spilled or the pail size due to not wanting to be near the spill. Safety advised Kirk Smith that Cura can provide the information needed. Kirk Smith advised his chest being tight due to the odor of the spill. Safety advised to contact medical attention if needed. Safety advised Kirk Smith the freight is not PIH. Reagan Cowdrey with Cura was contacted for remediat ion. Safety will update the spill report.
